symbols.name: sap.tnt
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library with controls specialized for administrative applications.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.IllustratedMessageType
symbols.description: Available TNT Illustration types for the {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage} control.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.InfoLabel
symbols.description:
The InfoLabel is a small non-interactive control which contains text information and non-semantic color chosen from a list of predefined color schemes. It serves the purpose to attract the user attention to some piece of information (state, quantity, condition, etc.).

Overview

The control visualizes text information without user interaction. The text-background color pair can be changed by setting a number between 1 and 10 that corresponds to the 10 predefined color combinations of the colorScheme property. The control is designed to be vertically aligned with UI5 Input and Button control families. When using InfoLabel in non-editable Forms, Tables, etc., set displayOnly=true for best visual results.

Usage Guidelines

  • If the text is longer than the width of the control, it doesn’t wrap. Instead, it’s represented as ellipsis.
  • When truncated, the full text in the control is not visible. Therefore, it’s recommended to make more space for longer items to be fully displayed.
  • Colors are not semantic and have no visual representation in sap_belize_hcb, sap_belize_hcw, sap_fiori_3_hcb and sap_fiori_3_hcw themes.
  • The control shows plain text only, formatting is not visualized.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Specifies the text inside the InfoLabel control.

properties.name: renderMode
properties.description: Specifies the type of the InfoLabel paddings - loose or narrow. Note: By default the padding is loose. It is recommended to use narrow (smaller) paddings for numeric texts. Note: In Horizon theme there is only one mode and setting this property will not have effect.

properties.name: colorScheme
properties.description: Specifies the fill and text color of the control. Accepts a number between 1 and 10 as a value. You can choose from 10 predefined background and text color combinations. The color schemes are non-semantic, you can select them according to your own preferences. Note: ColorScheme 10 is available only in Fiori 3 and Horizon themes. The default colorScheme is 7.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the InfoLabel control. By default, the InfoLabel control has the width of the content. Set this property to restrict the width to a custom value.

properties.name: displayOnly
properties.description: Determines if the InfoLabel is in displayOnly mode. When set to true the control size adjusts to fit other controls, for example non-editable Forms.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Available options for the text direction are LTR and RTL. By default the control inherits the text direction from its parent control.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the InfoLabel. It can be an icon from the icon font.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new InfoLabel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: bindText

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oBindingInfo
parameters.description: The binding information

methods.description: Binds property {@link #getText text} to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindProperty ManagedObject.bindProperty} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.tnt.InfoLabel with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.

methods.name: getColorScheme

returnValue.description: Value of property colorScheme

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getColorScheme colorScheme}. Specifies the fill and text color of the control. Accepts a number between 1 and 10 as a value. You can choose from 10 predefined background and text color combinations. The color schemes are non-semantic, you can select them according to your own preferences. Note: ColorScheme 10 is available only in Fiori 3 and Horizon themes. The default colorScheme is 7. Default value is 7.

methods.name: getDisplayOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property displayOnly

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayOnly displayOnly}. Determines if the InfoLabel is in displayOnly mode. When set to true the control size adjusts to fit other controls, for example non-editable Forms. Default value is false.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the InfoLabel. It can be an icon from the icon font. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.tnt.InfoLabel.

methods.name: getRenderMode

returnValue.description: Value of property renderMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRenderMode renderMode}. Specifies the type of the InfoLabel paddings - loose or narrow. Note: By default the padding is loose. It is recommended to use narrow (smaller) paddings for numeric texts. Note: In Horizon theme there is only one mode and setting this property will not have effect. Default value is Loose.

methods.name: getText

returnValue.description: Value of property text

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getText text}. Specifies the text inside the InfoLabel control. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getTextDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property textDirection

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextDirection textDirection}. Available options for the text direction are LTR and RTL. By default the control inherits the text direction from its parent control. Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Specifies the width of the InfoLabel control. By default, the InfoLabel control has the width of the content. Set this property to restrict the width to a custom value.

methods.name: setColorScheme

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iColorScheme
parameters.description: New value for property colorScheme

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getColorScheme colorScheme}. Specifies the fill and text color of the control. Accepts a number between 1 and 10 as a value. You can choose from 10 predefined background and text color combinations. The color schemes are non-semantic, you can select them according to your own preferences. Note: ColorScheme 10 is available only in Fiori 3 and Horizon themes. The default colorScheme is 7. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 7.

When set to true the control size adjusts to fit other controls, for example non-editable Forms. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.IToolHeader
symbols.description: Interface for controls suitable for the header aggregation of {@link sap.tnt.ToolPage}.

deprecated.text: This interface is not needed anymore. The ToolPage now accepts any control as a header or subheader.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.NavigationList
symbols.description: The NavigationList control is an interactive control, which provides a choice of different items, ordered as a list.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the control.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Specifies if the control is in expanded or collapsed mode.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The items displayed in the list.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs, which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: itemSelect
events.description: Fired when an item is selected.

events.name: itemPress
events.description: Fired when an item is pressed.

ctrlKey.name: ctrlKey
ctrlKey.description: Indicates whether the CTRL key was pressed when the link was selected.

shiftKey.name: shiftKey
shiftKey.description: Indicates whether the Shift key was pressed when the link was selected.

altKey.name: altKey
altKey.description: Indicates whether the Alt key was pressed when the link was selected.

metaKey.name: metaKey
metaKey.description:
Indicates whether the "meta" key was pressed when the link was selected.

On Macintosh keyboards, this is the command key (⌘). On Windows keyboards, this is the windows key (⊞).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new NavigationList. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

On Macintosh keyboards, this is the command key (⌘). On Windows keyboards, this is the windows key (⊞).

Indicates whether the "meta" key was pressed when the link was selected.

Specifies the width of the control.

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position

Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

parameters.description: The item to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getExpanded expanded}. Specifies if the control is in expanded or collapsed mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.NavigationListItem
symbols.description: The NavigationListItem represents a navigation action, which can be selected by the user. It can provide sub items.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Specifies the icon for the item.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Specifies if the item should be shown.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description:
Specifies if the item can be selected. By default all items are selectable. When a parent item's selectable property is set to false, selecting it will only expand or collapse its sub-items. To improve user experience do not mix selectable parent items with not selectable parent items within a single side navigation. Guidelines:
  • Items that have a set href and target set to _blank should not be selectable.
  • Items that trigger actions (with design "Action") should not be selectable.

experimental.text: Disclaimer: this property is in a beta state - incompatible API changes may be done before its official public release.

properties.name: href
properties.description: Defines the link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the select event should be registered.

properties.name: target
properties.description:
Specifies the browsing context where the linked content will open. Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. Guidelines:
  • Use only when href property is set.
  • Items that have a set href and target set to _blank should not have children
  • Items that have a set href, should not use target for internal navigation/li>

properties.name: design
properties.description: Specifies if the item has a special design. NOTE: If design is not NavigationListItemDesign.Default sub-items can't be added.

properties.name: ariaHasPopup
properties.description: Specifies the value of the aria-haspopup attribute

events.name: select
events.description: Fired when this item is selected.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getAriaHasPopup

returnValue.description: Value of property ariaHasPopup

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAriaHasPopup ariaHasPopup}. Specifies the value of the aria-haspopup attribute Default value is None.

methods.name: getDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property design

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDesign design}. Specifies if the item has a special design. NOTE: If design is not NavigationListItemDesign.Default sub-items can't be added. Default value is Default.

methods.name: getHref

returnValue.description: Value of property href

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHref href}. Defines the link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the select event should be registered.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. Specifies the icon for the item. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

The sub items.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.tnt.NavigationListItem.

methods.name: getSelectable

returnValue.description: Value of property selectable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectable selectable}. Specifies if the item can be selected. By default all items are selectable. When a parent item's selectable property is set to false, selecting it will only expand or collapse its sub-items. To improve user experience do not mix selectable parent items with not selectable parent items within a single side navigation. Guidelines:
  • Items that have a set href and target set to _blank should not be selectable.
  • Items that trigger actions (with design "Action") should not be selectable.
Default value is true.

experimental.text: Disclaimer: this property is in a beta state - incompatible API changes may be done before its official public release.

methods.name: getTarget

returnValue.description: Value of property target

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTarget target}. Specifies the browsing context where the linked content will open. Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. Guidelines:
  • Use only when href property is set.
  • Items that have a set href and target set to _blank should not have children
  • Items that have a set href, should not use target for internal navigation/li>

methods.name: getVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property visible

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVisible visible}. Specifies if the item should be shown. Default value is true.

methods.name: indexOfItem

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The item whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.tnt.NavigationListItem in the aggregation {@link #getItems items}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a item into the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

methods.name: removeAllItems

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeItem

returnValue.description: The removed item or null

parameters.name: vItem
parameters.description: The item to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a item from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Indicates whether the "meta" key was pressed when the link was selected.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.NavigationListItemDesign
symbols.description:
Available types for navigation list item.

This enum is part of the 'sap/tnt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'NavigationListItemDesign'.

properties.name: Action
properties.description: Navigation list item type which provides access to frequent functionality.

properties.name: Default
properties.description: Navigation list item type which enables navigation or contains navigation child items, or both.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.RenderMode
symbols.description: Predefined types of InfoLabel This enum is part of the 'sap/tnt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'RenderMode'.

properties.name: Loose
properties.description: When type of the content of InfoLabel is text padding are loose

properties.name: Narrow
properties.description: When type of the content of InfoLabel is numeric paddings are narrow

symbols.name: sap.tnt.SideNavigation
symbols.description:
The SideNavigation control is a container, which consists of flexible and fixed parts on top of each other.

Responsive Behavior

  • The flexible part adapts its size to the fixed one.
  • The flexible part has a scrollbar when the content is larger than the available space.
Note: In order for the SideNavigation to stretch properly, its parent layout control should only be the sap.tnt.ToolPage. Note: If used outside the intended parent layout sap.tnt.ToolPage, for example inside a sap.m.ResponsivePopover to achieve a Side Navigation Overlay Mode, the application developer should set the design property to Plain.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Specifies the width of the control.

<Note:> Depending on the theme, there is a minimum width set (16rem for Horizon theme). This property can be used to set a bigger width.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Specifies if the control is expanded.

properties.name: ariaLabel
properties.description: Specifies an optional aria-label that can be used by the screen readers.

properties.name: design
properties.description: Specifies whether the control should have own container styling, such as a box-shadow and border, or not. Note: This property has to be set to Plain when the control is used inside a sap.m.ResponsivePopover to achieve a Side Navigation Overlay Mode.

aggregations.name: item
aggregations.description: Defines the content inside the flexible part.

aggregations.name: fixedItem
aggregations.description: Defines the content inside the fixed part.

aggregations.name: footer
aggregations.description: Defines the content inside the footer.

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Specifies the width of the control. Depending on the theme, there is a minimum width set (16rem for Horizon theme). This property can be used to set a bigger width. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: unbindItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Unbinds aggregation {@link #getItem item} from model data.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.SideNavigationDesign
symbols.description:
Available options for the Side Navigation design.

This enum is part of the 'sap/tnt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'SideNavigationDesign'.

properties.name: Decorated
properties.description: Side Navigation has a shadow and border.

properties.name: Plain
properties.description: Side Navigation without any shadow or border.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.ToolHeader
symbols.description:
The ToolHeader control is a horizontal container that is most commonly used to display buttons, texts, and other various input controls.

Overview

The ToolHeader control is based on {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar}. It contains clearly structured menus of commands that are available across the various apps within the same tool layout.

Usage

  • This control is specialized for administrative applications. For other types of applications use: {@link sap.m.Shell}
  • If an app implements side navigation in addition to the tool header menu, the menu icon must be the first item on the left-hand side of the tool header.
  • The app menu and the side navigation must not have any dependencies and must work independently.

Horizon theme specifics

Only the following controls are supported: sap.m.Button, sap.m.Image, sap.m.Title, sap.m.Text, sap.m.SearchField, sap.m.Avatar.

Fiori 3 theme specifics

In Fiori 3 Default theme the ToolHeader is with dark design unlike most of the other controls. This defines the usage of limited controls inside it, which will result in good design combination.
The ToolHeader stylizes the contained controls with the Shell color parameters, to match the dark design requirement. However, that's not a dark theme.

Only the following controls are supported:
Control name Supported Not supported
sap.m.Text Single line text, text truncation Wrapping
sap.m.Title Single line text, text truncation. Consider using title headings of H4, H5, H6. Wrapping
sap.m.Label Single line text, text truncation Wrapping
sap.m.ObjectStatus Labels, semantic colors Indication colors
sap.ui.core.Icon sap.ui.core.IconColor enumeration for both icons and backgrounds. Interaction state colors
sap.m.Button Buttons in their Back, Default, Transparent and Up types. All four types are over-styled to look as transparent buttons. -
sap.m.MenuButton Emphasized button type. Should be used for triggering Mega menu. If there is no Mega menu, use Title (H6) instead.
Default (over-styled as Transparent) and Transparent types are used for standard menu representation.		 -
sap.m.Select Default and IconOnly types. IconOnly looks like a button while Default looks is like an input. Semantic states
sap.m.SearchField Support for the regular state of the control. -
sap.m.IconTabHeader All background design variations (all are transparent). Text tab filters or text and count tab filters in Inline mode only. Semantic colors, icons and separators.
sap.f.Avatar/sap.m.Avatar Support for default (Accent 6) color. Image avatar. -
sap.m.Image Primarily used for displaying the company logo. Interaction states

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ToolHeader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar#constructor sap.m.OverflowToolbar} can be used.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.tnt.ToolHeader with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar.extend}.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.tnt.ToolHeader.

symbols.name: sap.tnt.ToolPage
symbols.description:
The ToolPage is a layout control, used to create a basic tools app that has a header, side navigation and contents area.

Overview

The control has three main areas - a header on top, navigation to the side and a content area that can hold any control. The header and side navigation use custom controls - {@link sap.tnt.ToolHeader} and {@link sap.tnt.SideNavigation}.

Usage

The main usage of the sap.tnt controls is for scenarios in the tooling or administration space.

properties.name: sideExpanded
properties.description: Indicates if the side menu is expanded. Overrides the expanded property of the sideContent aggregation.

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description: The control to appear in the header area.

aggregations.name: subHeader
aggregations.description: The control to appear in the subheader area.

aggregations.name: sideContent
aggregations.description: The side menu of the layout.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ToolPage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addMainContent

parameters.name: oMainContent
parameters.description: The mainContent to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some mainContent to the aggregation {@link #getMainContents mainContents}.

methods.name: destroyHeader

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys the subHeader in the aggregation {@link #getSubHeader subHeader}.

parameters.description: The mainContent whose index is looked for

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The mainContent to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the mainContent should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the mainContent is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the mainContent is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a mainContent into the aggregation {@link #getMainContents mainContents}.

methods.name: removeAllMainContents

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getMainContents mainContents}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

returnValue.description: The removed mainContent or null

parameters.description: The mainContent to remove or its index or id
